message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CE, cs.NA, cs.DB, cs.LG

The paper describes a new approach to calculations of the Custom Correlation Coefficient (CCC) between Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs) across a population, suitable for parallel systems equipped with graphics processing units (GPUs) or Intel Xeon Phi processors. This involves mapping the algorithms to accelerated processors, eliminating redundant calculations due to symmetries, and efficient mapping of the calculations to many-node parallel systems. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science). Additionally, the paper involves numerical analysis and optimization techniques, which suggest the sub-categories cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) and cs.DB (Databases) as likely candidates. Finally, the paper also involves machine learning techniques, which suggest the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning) as a possible category.
